newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo Nikkei slips near close, ends below 20,500.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo Nikkei slips near close, ends below 20,500.

text.p: Tokyo's key benchmark, the Nikkei 225, closed beneath the 20,500 line on Thursday for the first time since September 12, brokers said. They said that most investors were sidelined, with futures-linked selling weighing heavily on the average.
The Nikkei average fell 214.81 points or 1.04 percent to 20,466.86. Its December futures sank 230 points to 20,460, by the end of the session.
"Right before the market closed, bouts of index selling emerged, dragging the average below the 20,500 level," one broker said.
